name: Marrington Plantation
description:
Hunting begins August 15th. Hunting takes place on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Afternoons. Trails are closed starting at 4 PM and ends 30 minutes after sunset. Be off the trail by 3 PM on these days.

 Hunting on Saturdays, Sundays, and Federal Holidays begins 30 minutes before sunrise and ends at 9 AM. Do not ride trails before 9 AM. 

Signs will be posted at the trailhead. Information on the signs may differ from the above. Hunting ends January 1st. 

Marrington Plantation offers a 12-mile perimeter loop that never drops or rises more than 20 feet at once, with the countless v-ditch crossings, sharp curves, and opportunities for jumps and drop-offs keep the ride challenging. Several technical offshoots are scattered along the ride and additional cut-throughs lengthen the total ride opportunity to 17 miles.

name: Biggens
description: Great trail, well maintained, and it's in a safe area. Considering this is in the Low Country, this trail ofers some elevation changes and terrain features. It's great for hiking, running and biking! A fun 4.8 mile loop that rides well in either direction. The trail alternates directions based on the day of the month. Even days it rides clockwise, and odd days it rides counter clockwise.

name: Saw Mill
description: Great trail for riding road or mountain bikes. Park has a paved path (about 6-7 miles from start to finish) for road or mountain bikes and adjacent off road paths for mountain bikes.
